chapter.title: Reporting Data
chapter.para: GMAT provides several ways to report mission data (such as altitude or ΔV values) to plain text files. GMAT can report data at each integration time step in the mission or at specific mission events, such as periapsis passage. The report functionality is controlled via the ReportFile resource and the Report and Toggle commands.

section.title: Reporting Data During Propagation
section.para: You can report data at each integration step in the mission sequence by creating a ReportFile resource and adding data to it. Starting from the default mission:

listitem.para: In the Resources tree, right-click the Output folder, point to Add, and click ReportFile.
Double-click ReportFile1 to open its properties window.
In the Parameter List area, click Edit.
In the Selected Value(s) list, click DefaultSC.EarthMJ2000.X and click <- to remove it from the list.
In the Object Properties list, click Altitude and click -> to add it to the Selected Value(s) list.
Add DefaultSC.A1ModJulian to the Selected Value(s) list if it doesn’t already exist.
Click OK, then in the ReportFile - ReportFile1 window, click OK again.

Click Run (
). To view the generated report, on the Output tree, double-click ReportFile1.

section.para: The script for the report data configured above is shown below.

section.title: Reporting Data at a Specific Mission Event
section.para: You can report data to a ReportFile at a specific time (for example, at orbit apoapsis) using the Report command. Starting from the default mission, first configure the ReportFile resource:

step.para: In the Resources tree, right-click on the Output folder, point to Add, and click ReportFile.
In the Output folder, double-click ReportFile1 to edit its properties.
In the Parameter List area, click Edit.
In the Selected Values list, click DefaultSC.EarthMJ2000Eq.X and click <- to remove it from the list.
Remove DefaultSC.A1ModJulian from the Selected Value(s) list in the same way.
Click OK to close the ParameterSelectDialog window and click OK again to close the ReportFile1 window.

section.para: Now configure the Propagate1 command to propagate to orbit apoapsis:

step.para: Click the Mission tab to display the Mission tree.
In the Mission tree, double-click Propagate1 to edit its properties.
Under Stopping Conditions, click the ... button to the left of DefaultSC.ElapsedSecs.
In the Object Properties list, click Apoapsis, then click the -> button to add it to the Selected Value(s) list.
Click OK to close the ParameterSelectDialog window, then click OK again to close the Propagate1 window.
In the Mission tree, right-click Propagate1, point to Insert After, and click Report.
Double-click Report1 to edit its properties, then click the View button.
Click the <= button to remove all items from the Selected Value(s) list.
In the Object Properties list, click TA, then click the -> button to add it to the Selected Value(s) list.
Add Altitude to the Selected Value(s) list in the same way.
Click OK to close the ParameterSelectDialog window, then click OK to close the Report1 window.

Click Run (
) to run the mission.
Click the Output tab to show the Output tree.
In the Reports folder, double-click ReportFile1 to see the requested data.

section.para: The script for the report data configured above is shown below.
section.programlisting:
Create ReportFile ReportFile1
BeginMissionSequence
Propagate DefaultProp(DefaultSC) {DefaultSC.Earth.Apoapsis} Report ReportFile1 DefaultSC.Earth.TA DefaultSC.Earth.Altitude

section.title: Creating a CCSDS Ephemeris File
section.para: The CCSDS Orbit Ephemeris Message (OEM) is a standardized text-based ephemeris format. In GMAT, you can easily create an OEM file with your desired interpolation order and data frequency. Starting from the default mission:

step.para: In the Resources tree, right-click the Output folder, point to Add, and click EphemerisFile. A new resource called EphemerisFile1 appears in the tree.
Double-click EphemerisFile1 to open it.
Make sure that in the File Format list, CCSDS-OEM is selected.
Click Ok.

Click Run (
). The OEM file will be written to a file named EphemerisFile1.eph in GMAT's output folder. By default, this folder is <GMAT>/output, where <GMAT> is the path to your GMAT installation.

section.para: The script for the resource configured above is shown below.
section.programlisting: Create EphemerisFile EphemerisFile1 EphemerisFile1.Spacecraft = DefaultSC EphemerisFile1.Filename = 'EphemerisFile1.eph' EphemerisFile1.FileFormat = CCSDS-OEM EphemerisFile1.EpochFormat = UTCGregorian EphemerisFile1.InitialEpoch = InitialSpacecraftEpoch EphemerisFile1.FinalEpoch = FinalSpacecraftEpoch EphemerisFile1.StepSize = IntegratorSteps EphemerisFile1.InterpolationOrder = 7 EphemerisFile1.CoordinateSystem = EarthMJ2000Eq

section.title: Creating an SPK Ephemeris File
section.para: An SPK ephemeris is a binary file format used by the SPICE Toolkit created by NAIF. GMAT can write spacecraft state information to this format using your desired interpolation order and data frequency. Starting from the default mission:

step.para: In the Resources tree, right-click the Output folder, point to Add, and click EphemerisFile. A new resource called EphemerisFile1 appears in the tree.
Double-click EphemerisFile1 to open it.
In the File Format list, click SPK.
In the File Name box, replace the default value with EphemerisFile1.bsp. An SPK ephemeris requires the .bsp extension.
Click Ok.

Click Run (
). The SPK file will be written to a file named EphemerisFile1.bsp in GMAT's output folder.

section.para: The script for the resource configured above is shown below.
section.programlisting: Create EphemerisFile EphemerisFile1 EphemerisFile1.Spacecraft = DefaultSC EphemerisFile1.Filename = 'EphemerisFile1.bsp' EphemerisFile1.FileFormat = SPK EphemerisFile1.EpochFormat = UTCGregorian EphemerisFile1.InitialEpoch = InitialSpacecraftEpoch EphemerisFile1.FinalEpoch = FinalSpacecraftEpoch EphemerisFile1.StepSize = IntegratorSteps EphemerisFile1.InterpolationOrder = 7 EphemerisFile1.CoordinateSystem = EarthMJ2000Eq
